Class MainAppWindowController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainAppWindowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChildControllerListener
public class MainAppWindowController extends Object implements ChildControllerListener
Controller for the main application window. Manages navigation between views, handles menu button activation, keyboard shortcuts, view caching, and communication with child controllers. Also provides common UI utilities such as toast messages.
Version:
0.2
Author:
Artur Twardzik

  • Constructor Details

    • MainAppWindowController

      public MainAppWindowController(IssueManager manager, List<User> users)
      Constructs the main window controller with the required issue manager and list of users. Initializes navigation stacks and internal state.
      Parameters:
      manager - the issue manager to be used by the application
      users - list of users available in the system

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      JavaFX initialization method. Configures menu button icons and tooltips, sets up keyboard shortcuts, and loads the initial user account view.

    • onError

      public void onError(Exception e)
      Called by child controllers when an exception occurs. Displays a toast message and logs the stack trace.
      Specified by:
      onError in interface ChildControllerListener
      Parameters:
      e - the exception thrown by a child controller

    • registerShortcuts

      private void registerShortcuts(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Registers keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl/Cmd + N/I/F/U) for major navigation actions in the active scene.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to register accelerators in

    • setRightPane

      private void setRightPane(javafx.scene.Node content)
      Replaces the entire right-side content area with the provided UI node.
      Parameters:
      content - the node to display on the right side

      Pushes the current right-side content to the navigation stack and then displays the provided content.
      Parameters:
      content - the new UI node to display

      public void goBack()
      Navigates back to the previously displayed right-side view and restores the corresponding menu button state.

    • makeButtonActive

      private void makeButtonActive(javafx.scene.control.Button button)
      Visually marks the given menu button as active (highlighted) and restores the previous button's appearance.
      Parameters:
      button - the button to activate, or null to deactivate all

    • onFilterButtonClick

      void onFilterButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Opens or restores the Filter Issues view. If already loaded once, restores cached content instead of reloading FXML.
      Parameters:
      event - the UI action event (may be null)

    • onIssuesButtonClick

      void onIssuesButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Opens or restores the Issues List view. Initializes the controller on first load.
      Parameters:
      event - the UI action event (may be null)

    • onNewButtonClick

      void onNewButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Opens or restores the New Issue creation view. If editing an issue, loads it into the view.
      Parameters:
      event - the UI action event (may be null)

    • onUserButtonClicked

      void onUserButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Opens the user account management view and populates it with user data.
      Parameters:
      event - the UI action event (may be null)

    • setIssuePane

      public void setIssuePane(Issue issue)
      Displays the Issue View for the specified issue.
      Parameters:
      issue - the issue to display

    • addIssue

      public void addIssue(Issue issue)
      Adds a new issue to the IssueManager and resets creation state.
      Parameters:
      issue - the issue to add

    • updateIssue

      public void updateIssue(Issue issue, Issue newValue)
      Updates the specified issue with values from another Issue instance and resets creation state.
      Parameters:
      issue - the target issue to update
      newValue - the source containing updated field values

    • setEditIssuePane

      public void setEditIssuePane(Issue issue)
      Opens the New Issue view pre-populated with the provided issue for editing.
      Parameters:
      issue - the issue to edit

      Returns:
